required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Pilot Randomized Controlled Trial of Financial Incentives, Text Messaging, and Usual Care for Homeless Smokers
clinical_study.official_title: The QUIT Smoking Study: A Pilot Randomized Controlled Trial of Financial Incentives, Text Messaging, and Usual Care to Help Homeless Smokers Quit Smoking

brief_summary.textblock: The QUIT (Quitting with Usual Care, Incentives, and Technology) Smoking Study is a 3-arm pilot randomized controlled trial that will test the effect of 2 different experimental smoking cessation interventions relative to a control condition in homeless cigarette smokers. All participants will receive free transdermal nicotine patches and weekly in-person smoking cessation counseling. In addition, participants randomized to the first experimental condition will receive financial rewards for biochemically-verified smoking abstinence, and participants randomized to the second experimental condition will be enrolled in a text messaging program to support smoking abstinence.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Biochemically-verified Smoking Abstinence, Assessed 14 Times Over 8 Weeks
primary_outcome.time_frame: Point-in-time abstinence assessed in a repeated fashion 14 times over the 8-week study period
primary_outcome.description: The primary outcome is a repeated-measures assessment of smoking abstinence, defined as an exhaled carbon monoxide <8ppm and assessed 14 times over the 8-week study period (3 times/week for the first 2 weeks, 2 times/week for the next 2 weeks, and once every week for the last 4 weeks)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Visits Abstinent of Smoking
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of 14 assessment visits at which a participant is abstinent of smoking, defined as an exhaled carbon monoxide level <8ppm.

secondary_outcome.measure: Smoking Abstinence at End of Study
secondary_outcome.description: Point-prevalence smoking abstinence, defined as an exhaled carbon monoxide level <8ppm, at the 14th (final) study visit.
Changes in the average number of cigarettes per day relative to baseline, defined by self-report and repeatedly assessed at the 8 assessment visits occurring on Fridays.

Past-month drug use severity (score range 0-1), past-month alcohol use severity (score range 0-1), and past-month psychiatric severity (0-1) were each assessed with the Addiction Severity Index (ASI) - 5th Edition, at baseline and at the 10th and 14th study visits. For each ASI measure, higher scores represent greater drug, alcohol, or psychiatric severity. Changes in ASI scores between baseline and 4 or 8 weeks can range from -1 to +1. When interpreting changes in scores, negative values indicate decreases in scores from baseline to 4 or 8 weeks, and positive values indicate increases in scores from baseline to 4 or 8 weeks.
Days of nicotine replacement therapy use in past week, repeatedly measured at the 8 assessment visits occurring on Fridays.

other_outcome.time_frame: Until target number of participants is reached; anticipate ~6 months
other_outcome.description: Total time to recruit, enroll, and randomize 75 study participants.
Percentage of participants who still have their mobile phone at the end of the study.
Text messaging group only: number who enrolled in SmokefreeTXT, number who replied to query texts sent by SmokefreeTXT.

arm_group.description: Transdermal nicotine patch In-person smoking cessation counseling
Transdermal nicotine patch In-person smoking cessation counseling Contingent financial rewards for smoking abstinence
Transdermal nicotine patch In-person smoking cessation counseling Text messages to support smoking abstinence

intervention.description: ≥10 cigarettes per day: nicotine 21mg/24hr patch daily x 6 weeks, then nicotine 14mg/24hr patch daily x 2 weeks <10 cigarettes per day: nicotine 14mg/24hr patch daily x 8 weeks
- One-on-one 15-minute counseling sessions once per week for 8 weeks

intervention.intervention_name: Contingent financial rewards for smoking abstinence
intervention.description: - Escalating-value financial rewards for smoking abstinence, verified by exhaled carbon monoxide <8ppm

intervention.intervention_name: Text messages to support smoking abstinence
intervention.description: - 1-5 text messages per day starting up to 2 weeks before the quit date and continuing until 6 weeks after the quit date, delivered by SmokefreeTXT

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Proficient in English, assessed with items asking about native language and self-reported comfort communicating in English among non-native speakers.
- Age ≥18 years old, assessed by self-report and verified by date of birth.
- Has smoked ≥100 cigarettes and currently smokes ≥5 cigarettes per day, verified by an exhaled carbon monoxide level of ≥8 ppm.
- Ready to try quitting smoking within the next month.
- Currently homeless, assessed by self-report and defined as usually staying in an emergency shelter, transitional shelter, abandoned building, place of business, car or other vehicle, church or mission, hotel or motel, or anywhere outside during the past 7 days. Additionally, individuals will be considered currently homeless if they usually stayed in somebody else's house, apartment/condominium, or room in the past 7 days because of not having their own place to stay.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Currently pregnant, assessed by a urine pregnancy test conducted on all premenopausal biologic females who have not had a hysterectomy, or planning to become pregnant in the next 2 months.
- Past 30-day use of nicotine replacement therapy, bupropion, or varenicline for smoking cessation, assessed by self-report. Use of bupropion for reasons other than to quit smoking (e.g. depression) is permissible.
- Prior serious adverse reaction to the nicotine patch, defined as any reaction that was life-threatening or required hospitalization.
- Heart attack or chest pain within the past 2 weeks.
- Inability to read a sentence written at a Flesch-Kincaid grade level of 4.
- Inability to provide informed consent, assessed with knowledge questions about the material presented during the informed consent process that individuals must correctly answer before providing informed consent to participate.

facility.name: Boston Health Care for the Homeless Program

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Some participants (N=8) enrolled in the study but did not return for randomization.

group.title: Control (N=25)
group.description: Transdermal nicotine patch In-person smoking cessation counseling Transdermal nicotine patch: - ≥10 cigarettes per day: nicotine 21mg/24hr patch daily x 6 weeks, then nicotine 14mg/24hr patch daily x 2 weeks - <10 cigarettes per day: nicotine 14mg/24hr patch daily x 8 weeks In-person smoking cessation counseling: - One-on-one 15-minute counseling sessions once per week for 8 weeks

group.title: Financial Rewards (N=25)
group.description: Transdermal nicotine patch In-person smoking cessation counseling Contingent financial rewards for smoking abstinence Transdermal nicotine patch: - ≥10 cigarettes per day: nicotine 21mg/24hr patch daily x 6 weeks, then nicotine 14mg/24hr patch daily x 2 weeks - <10 cigarettes per day: nicotine 14mg/24hr patch daily x 8 weeks In-person smoking cessation counseling: - One-on-one 15-minute counseling sessions once per week for 8 weeks Contingent financial rewards for smoking abstinence: - Escalating-value financial rewards for smoking abstinence, verified by exhaled carbon monoxide <8ppm

group.title: Text Messaging (N=25)
group.description: Transdermal nicotine patch In-person smoking cessation counseling Text messages to support smoking abstinence Transdermal nicotine patch: - ≥10 cigarettes per day: nicotine 21mg/24hr patch daily x 6 weeks, then nicotine 14mg/24hr patch daily x 2 weeks - <10 cigarettes per day: nicotine 14mg/24hr patch daily x 8 weeks In-person smoking cessation counseling: - One-on-one 15-minute counseling sessions once per week for 8 weeks Text messages to support smoking abstinence: - 1-5 text messages per day starting up to 2 weeks before the quit date and continuing until 6 weeks after the quit date, delivered by SmokefreeTXT

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

measure.title: Fagerstrom Test for Nicotine Dependence
measure.description: Score range is 0-10, with higher scores indicating greater nicotine dependence.

measure.title: Quitting confidence
measure.description: 1-10 visual scale of confidence to quit, with higher scores indicating greater confidence to quit smoking.

measure.title: Quitting importance
measure.description: 1-10 visual scale of importance of quitting, with higher scores indicating greater importance of quitting smoking.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Biochemically-verified Smoking Abstinence, Assessed 14 Times Over 8 Weeks
outcome.description: The primary outcome is a repeated-measures assessment of smoking abstinence, defined as an exhaled carbon monoxide <8ppm and assessed 14 times over the 8-week study period (3 times/week for the first 2 weeks, 2 times/week for the next 2 weeks, and once every week for the last 4 weeks)
outcome.time_frame: Point-in-time abstinence assessed in a repeated fashion 14 times over the 8-week study period
outcome.population: Participants with missing data at a given time point were assumed non-abstinent at that time point.

measure.title: Change in Cigarette Consumption

measure.population: Participants with missing data at a given time point are excluded from calculation of mean changes in cigarette consumption for that time point.

outcome.title: Change in Behavioral Health
outcome.description: Past-month drug use severity (score range 0-1), past-month alcohol use severity (score range 0-1), and past-month psychiatric severity (0-1) were each assessed with the Addiction Severity Index (ASI) – 5th Edition, at baseline and at the 10th and 14th study visits. For each ASI measure, higher scores represent greater drug, alcohol, or psychiatric severity. Changes in ASI scores between baseline and 4 or 8 weeks can range from -1 to +1. When interpreting changes in scores, negative values indicate decreases in scores from baseline to 4 or 8 weeks, and positive values indicate increases in scores from baseline to 4 or 8 weeks.
outcome.population: Participants with missing data at a particular time point are excluded from calculation of mean change in ASI scores at that time point.

outcome.description: Text messaging group only: number who enrolled in SmokefreeTXT, number who replied to query texts sent by SmokefreeTXT.

group.title: Control (N=25)
group.description: Transdermal nicotine patch In-person smoking cessation counseling Transdermal nicotine patch: - ≥10 cigarettes per day: nicotine 21mg/24hr patch daily x 6 weeks, then nicotine 14mg/24hr patch daily x 2 weeks - <10 cigarettes per day: nicotine 14mg/24hr patch daily x 8 weeks In-person smoking cessation counseling: - One-on-one 15-minute counseling sessions once per week for 8 weeks

group.title: Financial Rewards (N=25)
group.description: Transdermal nicotine patch In-person smoking cessation counseling Contingent financial rewards for smoking abstinence Transdermal nicotine patch: - ≥10 cigarettes per day: nicotine 21mg/24hr patch daily x 6 weeks, then nicotine 14mg/24hr patch daily x 2 weeks - <10 cigarettes per day: nicotine 14mg/24hr patch daily x 8 weeks In-person smoking cessation counseling: - One-on-one 15-minute counseling sessions once per week for 8 weeks Contingent financial rewards for smoking abstinence: - Escalating-value financial rewards for smoking abstinence, verified by exhaled carbon monoxide <8ppm

group.title: Text Messaging (N=25)
group.description: Transdermal nicotine patch In-person smoking cessation counseling Text messages to support smoking abstinence Transdermal nicotine patch: - ≥10 cigarettes per day: nicotine 21mg/24hr patch daily x 6 weeks, then nicotine 14mg/24hr patch daily x 2 weeks - <10 cigarettes per day: nicotine 14mg/24hr patch daily x 8 weeks In-person smoking cessation counseling: - One-on-one 15-minute counseling sessions once per week for 8 weeks Text messages to support smoking abstinence: - 1-5 text messages per day starting up to 2 weeks before the quit date and continuing until 6 weeks after the quit date, delivered by SmokefreeTXT

measure.title: Use of Text Messaging Program
measure.description: Text messaging group only: number who enrolled in SmokefreeTXT, number who replied to query texts sent by SmokefreeTXT.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse event data were collected during the 8-week study period for each participant.
reported_events.desc: Participants were asked about adverse events at each of the 14 follow-up visits over 8 weeks.

group.title: Control (N=25)
group.description: Transdermal nicotine patch In-person smoking cessation counseling Transdermal nicotine patch: - ≥10 cigarettes per day: nicotine 21mg/24hr patch daily x 6 weeks, then nicotine 14mg/24hr patch daily x 2 weeks - <10 cigarettes per day: nicotine 14mg/24hr patch daily x 8 weeks In-person smoking cessation counseling: - One-on-one 15-minute counseling sessions once per week for 8 weeks

group.title: Financial Rewards (N=25)
group.description: Transdermal nicotine patch In-person smoking cessation counseling Contingent financial rewards for smoking abstinence Transdermal nicotine patch: - ≥10 cigarettes per day: nicotine 21mg/24hr patch daily x 6 weeks, then nicotine 14mg/24hr patch daily x 2 weeks - <10 cigarettes per day: nicotine 14mg/24hr patch daily x 8 weeks In-person smoking cessation counseling: - One-on-one 15-minute counseling sessions once per week for 8 weeks Contingent financial rewards for smoking abstinence: - Escalating-value financial rewards for smoking abstinence, verified by exhaled carbon monoxide <8ppm

group.title: Text Messaging (N=25)
group.description: Transdermal nicotine patch In-person smoking cessation counseling Text messages to support smoking abstinence Transdermal nicotine patch: - ≥10 cigarettes per day: nicotine 21mg/24hr patch daily x 6 weeks, then nicotine 14mg/24hr patch daily x 2 weeks - <10 cigarettes per day: nicotine 14mg/24hr patch daily x 8 weeks In-person smoking cessation counseling: - One-on-one 15-minute counseling sessions once per week for 8 weeks Text messages to support smoking abstinence: - 1-5 text messages per day starting up to 2 weeks before the quit date and continuing until 6 weeks after the quit date, delivered by SmokefreeTXT

event.description: Nausea or vomiting correlated with nicotine patch use
Sweatiness correlated with nicotine patch use
Headache correlated with nicotine patch use
Fatigue correlated with nicotine patch use
Dizziness correlated with nicotine patch use

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Small sample size; short duration of follow-up; primary outcome based exclusively on exhaled carbon monoxide measurement.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Travis P. Baggett, MD, MPH (Principal Investigator)
